subject: Re: [junit] Testing getXXX( ) and setXXX( ) methods
msgSnippet: ... I suppose that s true; however, as you point out... ... Most people make this mistake once, maybe twice, ever. I ve made it once. My current naming
messageBody:
Quoting Vladimir Bossicard <vladimir@...>:

> > One answer: do not test what cannot possibly break. If you really want
> a get()
> > and set() method, and most of the time they're built for no good
> reason, then
> > just code them. Unless they're doing something more than answering the
> value of
> > a field, they can't break.
>
> The bad news: it can break (been there, done that):
>
> public void setValue(int value) {
> value = value; // omitting the "this."
> }

I suppose that's true; however, as you point out...

> The good news: if you use setters/getters in your other test methods,
> you will rapidely find the bug.

Most people make this mistake once, maybe twice, ever. I've made it once. My
current naming conventions make it essentially impossible to happen again. Of
course, since I've just said that, I'll mess it up very soon.

I'll be sure to report on that. :)

J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's write software that people understand.
